definition: to surpass others/outstanding/(basketball, soccer etc) to get past an opponent
to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen
an outstanding talent (idiom)/surpassing insight and acumen

sentences.english: None of it could have happened without off-the-charts courage.
sentences.chinese: 如果他沒有過人的勇氣，這一切都不可能發生。

sentences.english: Since childhood love of art, hard-working people, self-taught.
sentences.chinese: 自幼熱愛美術，勤奮過人，自學成材。

sentences.english: We do have a remarkable talent for cooking up crazy get-rich schemes.
sentences.chinese: 在炮製瘋狂發財計劃方面，我們的確有過人才華。

sentences.english: Sheila was too clever to believe Ted's flattery.
sentences.chinese: 希拉聰明過人，不會相信特德的花言巧語。

sentences.english: Rest our faith on God's power, not human wisdom.
sentences.chinese: 神的愚拙遠勝過人的智慧。

sentences.english: His forte at Goldman, above all, was deal-making.
sentences.chinese: 他在高盛的過人之處在於交易決策。

sentences.english: Attlee was extremely intelligent and his grasp of the situation was masterly.
sentences.chinese: 阿特利聰明過人，對局勢的把握頗爲高明。

sentences.english: He has an intrepid disposition, and great strength.
Never forget that no military leader has ever become great without audacity .
sentences.chinese: 偉大的軍事領袖無不膽識過人。

sentences.english: The company has several Solomons in its advisory body.
sentences.chinese: 這家公司的顧問中有好幾個才智過人的所羅門。

sentences.english: I do not have exceptional talent, it is not wise, I will be happy how?
sentences.chinese: 我沒有過人的天資，就得不到睿智，我怎麼會幸福？

sentences.english: My mind works like lightning, one brilliant flash and it's gone.
sentences.chinese: 我的頭腦動作快如閃電，睿智過人，一閃即逝。

sentences.english: Mr. Chen had said that people become innocent again on the bridge.
sentences.chinese: 老陳曾經說過人到了橋上後會回到純真的狀態。

sentences.english: Being influenced by his father, he developed passion for music and he has outstanding piano skills.
sentences.chinese: 而在父親的耳濡目染下，他熱愛音樂並且琴藝過人。

sentences.english: Her husband is a demon for work.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫工作起來精力過人。

definition: to believe (sth in relation to oneself)/to regard oneself as/to acknowledge (sth in relation to oneself)/to resign oneself to
to rely on/to depend on/by means of/thanks to/sth that one relies on/also written 憑借|凭借[ping2 jie4]
to test/to put to the test/trial/ordeal
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
